uk.co.strangeskies.reflection

Class TypeResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.strangeskies.reflection.TypeResolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Copyable<TypeResolver>, DeepCopyable<TypeResolver>

    public class TypeResolver
extends Object
implements DeepCopyable<TypeResolver>

    A TypeResolver represents a view over an underlying BoundSet, and provides a number of important functionalities for interacting with that BoundSet. Multiple TypeResolvers can provide different views of the same BoundSet instance.

    Whenever any InferenceVariable is created by way of a TypeResolver instance, that InferenceVariable will be associated with a particular GenericDeclaration. Within this context, which is so described by a GenericDeclaration, at most only one InferenceVariable may by created for any given TypeVariable. A TypeResolver always creates InferenceVariable according to the behavior of inferTypeParameters(GenericDeclaration).

    A TypeResolver is a flexible and powerful tool, but for typical use-cases it may be recommended to use the more limited, but more type safe, facilities provided by the TypeToken and ExecutableToken classes.

      • deepCopy

        public TypeResolver deepCopy(Isomorphism isomorphism)
        Create a copy of an existing resolver. All the inference variables contained within the resolver will be substituted for the new inference variables, and all the bounds on them will be substituted for equivalent bounds. These mappings will be entered into the given map when they are made.
        Specified by:
        deepCopy in interface Copyable<TypeResolver>
        Specified by:
        deepCopy in interface DeepCopyable<TypeResolver>
        Parameters:
        isomorphism - an isomorphism for inference variables
        Returns:
        A newly derived resolver, with each instance of an inference variable substituted for new mappings.

      • inferTypeParameters

        public Stream<Map.Entry<TypeVariable<?>,InferenceVariable>> inferTypeParameters(GenericDeclaration declaration,
                                                                                ParameterizedType enclosing)
        Each type variable within the given GenericDeclaration, and each non-statically enclosing declaration thereof, is incorporated into the backing BoundSet.
        Parameters:
        declaration - the declaration we wish to incorporate
        enclosing - the parameterized enclosing declaration
        Returns:
        mapping from the InferenceVariables on the given declaration, to their new capturing InferenceVariables

      • inferTypeParameters

        public Stream<Map.Entry<TypeVariable<?>,InferenceVariable>> inferTypeParameters(GenericDeclaration declaration)
        Each type variable within the given GenericDeclaration, and each non-statically enclosing declaration thereof, is incorporated into the backing BoundSet.
        Parameters:
        declaration - the declaration we wish to incorporate
        Returns:
        a mapping from the InferenceVariables on the given declaration, to their new capturing InferenceVariables

      • inferTypeArguments

        public GenericArrayType inferTypeArguments(GenericArrayType type)
        Add inference variables for the type parameters of the given type to the resolver, then incorporate containment constraints based on the arguments of the given type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type whose generic type arguments we wish to perform inference operations over.
        Returns:
        A parameterized type derived from the given type, with inference variables in place of wildcards where appropriate.

      • inferTypeArguments

        public ParameterizedType inferTypeArguments(ParameterizedType type)
        Add inference variables for the type parameters of the given type to the resolver, then incorporate containment constraints based on the arguments of the given type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type whose generic type arguments we wish to perform inference operations over.
        Returns:
        A parameterized type derived from the given type, with inference variables in place of wildcards where appropriate.

        public ParameterizedType inferTypeParameters(Class<?> declaration)

      • inferWildcardType

        public InferenceVariable inferWildcardType(WildcardType type)
        Incorporate a new inference variable for a given wildcard type, and add the bounds of the wildcard as bounds to the inference variable.
        Parameters:
        type - The wildcard type to capture as a bounded inference variable.
        Returns:
        The new inference variable created to satisfy the given wildcard.

      • resolve

        public Stream<Map.Entry<InferenceVariable,Type>> resolve()
        Infer proper instantiations for each inference variable registered within this TypeResolver instance.
        Returns:
        A mapping from each inference variable registered under this resolver, to their newly inferred instantiations.

      • resolve

        public Type resolve(Type type)
        Infer a proper instantiations for each InferenceVariable mentioned by the given type.
        Parameters:
        type - the type whose proper form we wish to infer
        Returns:
        a new type derived from the given type by substitution of instantiations for each InferenceVariable mentioned

      • resolve

        public Stream<Map.Entry<InferenceVariable,Type>> resolve(Collection<? extends InferenceVariable> variables)
        Infer proper instantiations for the given InferenceVariables.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • substituteInstantiations

        public Type substituteInstantiations(Type type)
        Derive a new type from the type given, with any mentioned instances of InferenceVariable substituted with their proper instantiations where available, as per getInstantiation(InferenceVariable).
        Parameters:
        type - The type we wish to resolve.
        Returns:
        The resolved type.

      • getInstantiation

        public Type getInstantiation(InferenceVariable variable)
        Resolve the proper instantiation of a given InferenceVariable if one exists.
        Parameters:
        variable - The inference variable whose proper instantiation we wish to determine.
        Returns:
        The proper instantiation of the given InferenceVariable if one exists, otherwise the InferenceVariable itself.
